intro: Tarenna acuminata, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Tarenna acuminata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
